intro: Mesembryanthemum leptaleon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved iceplant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and flowers adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pale pink or white, blooming during the cooler months. Its leaves are fleshy and often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Mesembryanthemum leptaleon is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
